subject: p14841168
History: Year old woman with s/p OR, intubation, OGT placement, eval ETT placement, OGT placement.
Findings: An endotracheal tube terminates 41 cm above the carina. In enteric tube terminates in the proximal stomach and could be advanced 5-6 cm for ideal positioning. The cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable. Low lung volumes. Minimal elevation of the right hemidiaphragm is also stable. The left lung base is not visualized. Increased opacity at the base of the left lung may reflect atelectasis. There is mild vascular congestion with mild pulmonary edema. No pneumothorax.
Impression: Endotracheal tube 41 cm of the carina. Enteric tube should be advanced 5-6 cm for ideal positioning. No pneumothorax. The left lung base is only partially imaged however opacity at the base of the left lung likely reflects atelectasis or aspiration. Mild pulmonary edema.
